item.title: SilkAir will begin flying between Okinawa and Japan in January 2015
item.description:
SilkAir, the regional subsidiary of Singapore Airlines, will launch its inaugural charter flights between Singapore and Okinawa, Japan. Operated in partnership with Okinawa Tourist Service (OTS) and Jumbo Tours Okinawa, these monthly charters will run from September 9, 2014, to January 3, 2015. Utilizing Boeing 737-800 aircraft with both business and economy class seating, these direct flights aim to provide travelers with a convenient option to visit Okinawa. From September to October 2014, flights will depart Singapore Changi Airport Terminal 2 at 10:00 am and arrive at Okinawa Naha Airport at 4:15 pm...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/silkair-will-begin-flying-between-okinawa-and-japan-in-january-2015/

item.title: SilkAir will provide direct charter flights to Okinawa
item.description:
To encourage travel between Singapore and Okinawa, SilkAir, the Okinawa Prefecture government, Japan, and Changi Airport Group are collaborating on seven direct SilkAir charter flights. These flights will operate between June 1st and 25th, 2016, connecting Singapore and Okinawa, Japan’s southernmost prefecture. Travelers can book these full-service flights through Singapore travel agents. SilkAir’s Boeing 737-800 aircraft, featuring Business and Economy class cabins, will service the route. Passengers will enjoy a comprehensive range of full-service offerings, including a baggage allowance of 30kg for Economy and 40kg for Business class, inflight meals, and complimentary inflight entertainment through SilkAir Studio...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/silkair-will-provide-direct-charter-flights-to-okinawa/

item.title: Hong Kong Airlines introduces new flights to Okinawa, Hangzhou, and Ho Chi Minh
item.description:
On March 19th, Hong Kong Airlines launched new flights for its Hong Kong-Okinawa and Hong Kong-Hangzhou routes to meet the increasing demand from business and leisure travelers. The airline celebrated the occasion with events at Hong Kong International Airport and both destination airports. Alex Wu, Hong Kong Airlines General Manager of the Hong Kong Sales Office, welcomed passengers on the inaugural Okinawa flight HX678 with model airplanes. At the gate, passengers received certificates acknowledging their support for the new route...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/hong-kong-airlines-introduces-new-flights-to-okinawa-hangzhou-and-ho-chi-minh/
